education.field_of_study: Arts and Heritage: Policy, Management and Education

school.name: Dutch University Institute for Art History - Florence

awards.title: Cum Laude Bachelor of Arts
awards.description: With a 4.0 GPA and a Bachelor thesis result of 8.5 I graduated with honors from the University of Utrecht.

projects.title: STUDIO i - platform for inclusive culture
projects.description:
STUDIO i is a project initiated by two modern art museums in the Netherlands, the Stedelijk Museum Amsterdam and the Van Abbemuseum in Eindhoven. STUDIO i aims to generate and promote diversity and accessibility in the Dutch cultural sector.

Like many other cultural institutions in the Netherlands, the two project museums acknowledge that their audiences are quite exclusive: many of our visitors have similar cultural, socio-economical, hetero-normative backgrounds. Over the last few years the museums have therefore started programmes for audiences who previously did not visit: Onvergetelijk, Special Guests and Queering the Collection. With STUDIO i, they want to take another step towards inclusion and embrace diversity in their own museums as well as the broader cultural sector – considering public, programmes and personnel. They do this together with partners in the field and other cultural organisations.

In 2019, I was the interim projectleader of the project at the Van Abbemuseum in Eindhoven, to cover for the maternity leave of Marleen Hartjes. After the interim period, I was asked by the Stedelijk Museum Amsterdam to stay on as project officer for the project.

projects.title: Becoming More
projects.description:
Becoming More is a ten-day caucus comprising of lectures, performances, screenings, commissions, discussions and food hosted by the Van Abbemuseum, Eindhoven. 

On the 10th anniversary of the research and exhibition project Be(com)ing Dutch it is time to convene again – to come together to strengthen existing alliances and to develop new affinities. Through the caucus we will ask how art can provide a productive, critical space where solidarities are formed and political visions rehearsed. In other words, it will ask: ‘How can we become more?’

For Becoming More, the Van Abbemuseum invited artists, organizers and thinkers working in the Netherlands to author distinct days, bringing different forms of knowledge and experiences into the museum. We believe at this critical juncture of unrest, it is vital to listen, consolidate and share. The programme is the outcome of these extensive discussions from which a series of urgent topics have emerged.

In May 2017 I became part of the project team of the ten day caucus Becoming More. Responsibilities included:
- Creating and organizing an online communication strategy of the project on the museum website and social media channels.
- Writing a press release for the project.
- Editing the Dutch version of the programme booklet.
- Editing wall texts for the exhibitions of the programme.
- Organizing registration for the caucus through different channels (ticketing, We Are Public, Friends of the museum, and others), and keeping track of registrations.
- Maintaining contact with the caterers of the event.

projects.title: Tony Cokes: To Live as Equals
projects.description:
From 28 February–17 May 2020, BAK, basis voor actuele kunst, Utrecht proudly presents Tony Cokes: To Live as Equals. An exhibition and public program, curated by Thiago de Paula Souza, who was one of the BAK 2018/2019 Fellows. Tony Cokes: To Live as Equals brings together selected video works from the past 30 years, tracing Cokes’s unique formation of critique through visual and textual codes, and his changing relationship to archival material over several different global historical moments. The works draw a through line from these historical events to the present of systemic violence and ever-more-complex forms of social control. What are ways of seeing and responding to the seemingly endless cycles of inequality and oppression? How then, the exhibition queries, could one break those cycles and envision living as equals?  

I was in charge of the production of this exhibition.

projects.title: Mama Cash x BAK, basis voor actuele kunst
projects.description:
In 2020, Mama Cash and BAK, basis voor actuele kunst entered into a large-scale collaboration consisting of a three-day symposium for Mama Cash grantee partners, a dinner for local and international feminist activists, a special edition of Yallah Sabaya (a party just for women, especially focusing on women with a refugee and migrant background) and the Utrecht edition of the Mama Cash Feminist Festival.

I was in charge of production of this collaborative project.

projects.title: Propositions #10: Instituting Otherwise
projects.description:
Propositions #10: Instituting Otherwise is a one-day public symposium on the civic practice of art institutions, organized by BAK, basis voor actuele kunst, Utrecht on Saturday 7 December 2019, from 13.00–21.00 hrs. The symposium probes the question of how to institute spaces for art in the face of the pressing urgencies of the present.

With contributions by: Yasmin Ahmed (activist, Amsterdam), Isshaq Al-Barbary (artist and researcher, Amsterdam), Barby Asante (artist, curator, and educator, London), Matthijs de Bruijne (artist and union organizer, Amsterdam), Mitchell Esajas (anthropologist, curator, and social entrepreneur, Amsterdam), Jeanne van Heeswijk (artist, Rotterdam), Maria Hlavajova (General and Artistic Director of BAK, basis voor actuele kunst, Utrecht), Triwish Hanoeman (musician and cultural entrepreneur, Utrecht), Nicoline van Harskamp (artist, Amsterdam), Natalia Kulik (public speaker, moderator and project coordinator, Utrecht), Andrea Phillips (theorist and writer, London), Laura Raicovich (curator and writer, New York), Shay Raviv (social designer and researcher, Utrecht), Jun Saturay (artist, Utrecht), Mustapha Seray Bah (trainer, organizer, discussion leader, Utrecht), and others.

I was in charge of producing this event.

projects.title: TIK-TIK (first phase)
projects.description: In 2019 the Van Abbemuseum develops, together with blind designer Simon Dogger an indoor navigation app for blind visitors and to open up the museum in a multi sensory way. Next to working together with Simon for the production of a test version of the app, my main responsibilities included developing 15 multisensory interventions to be installed in the current exhibition 'The Making of Modern Art'.

projects.title: Who Owns The Street? / Van wie is de straat?
projects.description:
The exhibition Who Owns The Street? shows different ways of seeing the street – our public space. Who uses this public space? Who manages, controls and abuses it? Who is the owner and what responsibilities does this ownership entail? The Van Abbemuseum has invited four guests who each worked on a particular aspect of the use of public space. The subjects of the exhibition are explored in more detail in a series of lectures and debates in the museum on Thursday evenings, organised in cooperation with Architectuurcentrum Eindhoven. 

I assisted the project leader with the organisation of the exhibition and the series of lectures and debates. My responsibilities included communication with the partners, organizing meetings, coordinating online ticketing and communication, organizing the opening and in general assisting with the production of the exhibition.

projects.title: Bosch Grand Tour 2016
projects.description: I worked for the Van Abbemuseum as a representative in the Bosch Grand Tour project that is planned for 2016. This Grand Tour entails a collaboration between 7 Dutch museums. My responsibilities included collaborating with the other museums and the project leader, organizing events and organizing the production of a family tour for the Van Abbemuseum.

projects.title: Mix Match Museum
projects.description: Mix Match Museum entailed a collaboration between six Dutch museums, with a diverse collection of art and historical, natural and medical heritage. On an online platform people were invited to create their own exhibition with works of the six different collections. Each museum chose one or several exhibitions to carry out. My responsibilities included organizing meetings with colleagues from the other museums, writing press releases, co-designing a communication strategy, writing blogs for the online platform, selecting exhibitions in cooperance with our curator, communicating with our chosen guest curators, editing the booklet of the exhibition, organizing meetings for internal coordination.

projects.title: Tikkit Game Vincent van Gogh (Museumkids)
projects.description: I represented the Vincent van GoghHuis Zundert as an educator for this project. The project was organized by the Dutch Museum Association and involved a collaboration between the Van Gogh Museum, Gemeentemuseum Den Haag, the Kröller-Muller Museum, Vincent's Tekenlokaal Tilburg and Van GoghHuis Zundert. The project's goal was to create an online game for children about Vincent van Gogh, where children would learn something more about Van Gogh and the Van Gogh items in the collection of each collaborating institution. Together with representatives of other institutions, the Dutch Museum Association and interactive media company IJsfontein, I contributed to the development of the game by exchanging ideas about the concept of the game and its promotion, delivering content and evaluating the demo. As a representative of the Van GoghHuis I acted as a mediator between the Van GoghHuis and the Dutch Museum Association.

profile_positions.title: Project Officer STUDIO i - Platform for Inclusive Culture

profile_positions.description: BAK, basis voor actuele kunst is a leading international platform for theoretically-informed, politically-driven art and experimental research. Based in Utrecht, BAK addresses the social, ideological, and environmental urgencies of the present by combining public programming and exhibition-making with research, learning, and talent development. Working with communities involved in arts, activisms, and academia—and bringing artists, scholars, and other members of the precarious classes together—BAK cultivates art as a public sphere and a space for aesthetico-political experiments.
profile_positions.title: Communications Coordinator

profile_positions.description: Project management of the design exhibition 'Beyond Generations' in collaboration with the Design Academy Eindhoven.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager Exhibition

profile_positions.description: Temporarily replacing the senior online marketing and communications manager who was on sick leave. Responsibilities included maintaining the museum website and social media outlets, as well as developing online communication strategies for several projects.
profile_positions.title: Online Marketing and Communications Manager

profile_positions.description: In May 2017 I became part of the project team of the ten day caucus Becoming More. Responsibilities included organizing an online communication strategy, editing the Dutch version of the programme booklet and organizing and keeping track of registrations.
profile_positions.title: Project Assistant Event

profile_positions.description:
The Van Abbemuseum in Eindhoven is one of the first public museums for contemporary art to be established in Europe. The museum’s collection of around 2700 works of art includes key works and archives by Joseph Beuys, Marc Chagall, René Daniëls, Marlene Dumas, Sheela Gowda, Patricia Kaersenhout, Gülsün Karamustafa, Iris Kensmil, Oskar Kokoschka, John Körmeling, El Lissitzky, Paul McCarthy, Pablo Picasso, Martha Rosler, and Lidwien van de Ven. The museum has an experimental approach towards art’s role in society. Openness, hospitality and knowledge exchange are important to it.

The museum challenges itself and its visitors to think about art and its place in the world, covering a range of subjects, including the role of the collection as a cultural 'memory' and the museum as a public site. International collaboration and exchange have made the Van Abbemuseum a place for creative cross-fertilisation and a source of surprise, inspiration and imagination for its visitors and participants.


As project coordinator and communication employee for the Van Abbemuseum I have gained a broad experience within the museum: from education and communication to the production of exhibitions. I have worked on three very different projects, but all have one important aspect in common: working with several external partners is central to the project. Therefore I also developed an expertise in closely cooperating with other museums and organisations.
profile_positions.title: Project Coordinator and Communication Employee

profile_positions.description:
The Vincent van GoghHuis is an arts centre built on the native soil of one of the most famous artists in history. It’s not a traditional museum but an active world of experiences, for art lovers as well as tourists. It offers an agitating presentation about the life and works of Vincent van Gogh and interactive education.The permanent exhibition ‘Vincent van Gogh – The roots of a master’ tells the story of Vincent's youth in Zundert. The temporary exhibitions are all about artists of the 20th and 21st century who are inspired by the work and life of Vincent van Gogh. The Van Gogh Documentation Centre is all about education and research.

Projects:
- Tikkit game Vincent van Gogh (Museumkids)
profile_positions.title: Educator

profile_positions.description:
The Van Gogh Museum makes the life and work of Vincent van Gogh and the art of his time accessible and reaches as many people as possible in order to enrich and inspire them. 

For this internship I have conducted research into the possiblities of e-learning for the Van Gogh Museum. Research topics included:
- Formulating several target groups for an e-learning strategy.
- Researching viable business models.
- Analyzing best practices and relevant literature in order to determine factors of success.

Received grade: 9/10
profile_positions.title: Research Intern (Education Department)

volunteer_experiences.description:
ARTtube is the online video channel about art and design, with videos by museums and art institutions in the Netherlands and Belgium.

On ARTtube you find special interviews with and video portraits of prominent artists and designers. Museums and art institutions offer a glimpse behind the scenes at the build-up of exhibitions or the restoration of works of art and let their curators and conservators have their say. 


During the Lowlands Festival of 2017, I was part of the ARTtube crew, where my main responsibility was promoting the programme to festival visitors.

De missie van artBRUUT is om het werk van talentvolle Makom kunstenaars zónder sociale stempel te profileren en te exposeren binnen de gevestigde kunstscene van Amsterdam.

http://www.maghetlichtaanfestival.nl/programma/

http://www.stichting39.nl/

Authentication in Art (AiA) comprises a group of prominent international art world professionals who have come together to create a forum that can act to catalyse and promote best practices in art authentication. AiA has been created to provide leadership and shape dialogue, develop sound practice and liaise with the wider art community including international collectors, art historians, art market professionals, financial institutions, legal advisers, trust & estate practitioners and other stakeholders in the international art market.

During the 2014 congress in The Hague I was a member of the congress team.

Website: http://www.authenticationinart.org/

- Writing articles for the Dutch online magazine Nadelunch.com, which acts as a platform for young writers to develop their writing skills. I have written articles for the categories 'Ook dat nog' (short articles about all kinds of subjects), 'Beeld' (articles about film, theater and museums), and 'Buiten' (articles about travelling).
- Acting as an editor for several authors (around 6) for the category 'Ook dat nog'. Activities involve editing articles, planning and publishing them and providing authors with feedback (according to the principle of constructive criticism).

All these activities are conducted on a voluntary basis.

Author page: http://www.nadelunch.com/author/steffie/

The Vincent van GoghHuis is an arts centre built on the native soil of one of the most famous artists in history. It’s not a traditional museum but an active world of experiences, for art lovers as well as tourists. It offers an agitating presentation about the life and works of Vincent van Gogh and interactive education.The permanent exhibition ‘Vincent van Gogh – The roots of a master’ tells the story of Vincent's youth in Zundert. The temporary exhibitions are all about artists of the 20th and 21st century who are inspired by the work and life of Vincent van Gogh. The Van Gogh Documentation Centre is all about education and research. 

My responsibilities include:
- Providing information to visitors in the gallery and the exhibition area.
- Maintaining social media.

Website:
